candidates.title: Hyper 0.12 support
candidates.body:
This MR upgrades the swagger crate to use Hyper 0.12

This creates large scale changes:
   - `NewService` has been renamed `MakeService` - as such, we rename all implementing types.
        - `AddContextNewService` -> `AddContextMakeService`
        - The `MakeService` implementation of `AllowAllAuthenticator` is split into `MakeAllowAllAuthenticator`
        - `CompositeNewService` -> `CompositeMakeService`.

   - Hyper Services don't have the request as a type parameter -  instead the body of the request / response are type parameters. As such we create a new type, `ContextualPayload`, which implements `hyper::body::Payload`, and allows the addition of some contextual data.

   - `hyper::headers` has been removed. The replacement https://docs.rs/headers/0.2.1/headers/ doesn't provide a common interface, so in the interest of reducing change, we use a migration crate - https://crates.io/crates/hyper_old_types

    - `Into<HeaderValue>` is not implemented for useful things like Strings, Vecs of Strings and DateTime, so we add some utility functions in `swagger::header`.  We also add move common code for X Span ID here as well.

  - `hyper::client::Service` has been removed. We re-implement it in `swagger::client`, so we can implement Swagger middleware.

We upgrade `hyper-tls` to 0.2 (from 0.1). As per https://github.com/Metaswitch/swagger-rs/issues/51#issuecomment-486120194, we can't currently upgrade further (either `hyper-tls`, or `native-tls`, or `openssl`), due to native-tls limitations.

We remove any dependency on `tokio-core`, which is deprecated, as the codegen moves to using `tokio` directly as part of the `hyper` 0.12 work.

We take this opportuntity to move a bunch of static code in the codegen for multipart support into the crate. This is hidden behind a feature flag.

We remove the deprecated `AddContext` type.

candidates.title: Update base64 requirement from 0.5 to 0.10

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

candidates.body:
Updates the requirements on [base64](https://github.com/alicemaz/rust-base64) to permit the latest version.
Changelog *Sourced from [base64's changelog](https://github.com/alicemaz/rust-base64/blob/master/RELEASE-NOTES.md).* > # 0.10.0 > > - Remove line wrapping. Line wrapping was never a great conceptual fit in this library, and other features (streaming encoding, etc) either couldn't support it or could support only special cases of it with a great increase in complexity. Line wrapping has been pulled out into a [line-wrap](https://crates.io/crates/line-wrap) crate, so it's still available if you need it. > - `Base64Display` creation no longer uses a `Result` because it can't fail, which means its helper methods for common > configs that `unwrap()` for you are no longer needed > - Add a streaming encoder `Write` impl to transparently base64 as you write. > - Remove the remaining `unsafe` code. > - Remove whitespace stripping to simplify `no_std` support. No out of the box configs use it, and it's trivial to do yourself if needed: `filter(|b| !b" \n\t\r\x0b\x0c".contains(b)`. > - Detect invalid trailing symbols when decoding and return an error rather than silently ignoring them. > > # 0.9.3 > > - Update safemem > > # 0.9.2 > > - Derive `Clone` for `DecodeError`. > > # 0.9.1 > > - Add support for `crypt(3)`'s base64 variant. > > # 0.9.0 > > - `decode_config_slice` function for no-allocation decoding, analogous to `encode_config_slice` > - Decode performance optimization > > # 0.8.0 > > - `encode_config_slice` function for no-allocation encoding > > # 0.7.0 > > - `STANDARD_NO_PAD` config > - `Base64Display` heap-free wrapper for use in format strings, etc > > # 0.6.0 > > - Decode performance improvements > - Use `unsafe` in fewer places > - Added fuzzers > > # 0.5.2 > > - Avoid usize overflow when calculating length > - Better line wrapping performance > > # 0.5.1 > > - Temporarily disable line wrapping > ... (truncated)
Commits - See full diff in [compare view](https://github.com/alicemaz/rust-base64/commits/v0.10.0)

candidates.title: Allow ContextWrapper to be cloned
candidates.body:
Benjamin,

This is a straight forward, backwards compatible, addition to ContextWrapper to allow it to be cloned.

As ContextWrapper simply contains a context, and a reference to the API, it should be possible to clone it if the Context itself is clone-able.

This makes it easier to write client APIs using code generated by Swagger because it means a client with a context can easily be cloned. A client without a context is already clone-able.

It'd be good if this could be merged into both 1.x and 2.x - but I don't currently see a 1.x stable branch?

candidates.title: Improve context debugging
candidates.body:
Includes the following changes, which are intended to improve the clarity of the compiler errors when working with contexts:
- Split the `AddContext` wrapper into two structs implementing `NewService` and `Service` separately.
- Update the `new_context_type` macro to only implement `Has`, `Pop` and `Push` for types explicitly passed in to the macro

candidates.title: Refactor context
candidates.body:
Implements the changes to contexts discussed [here](https://metacom2.metaswitch.com/confluence/x/OrGGAg) and [here](https://github.com/swagger-api/swagger-codegen/issues/7925). The corresponding swagger codegen MR is [here](https://git.datcon.co.uk/tools.core/swagger-codegen/merge_requests/176).

In particular, this change replaces the old `Context` struct with the following:

- `Has<T>`, `Pop<T>` and `Push<T>` traits for specifying requirements on context types in hyper services
- `new_context_type!` macro for defining structs that can be used to build concrete context types that implement `Has` and `ExtendsWith`
- `make_context!` and `make_context_ty!` macros for defining concrete context values and types.

Also renames `NoAuthentication` to the more descriptive `AddContext` and moved it to its own module.

candidates.title: Composite service
candidates.body:
Implements composite versions of hyper `NewService`s and `Service`s, allowing multiple services to be served on the same port.

Because the `NewService`s being combined may have different types, and may have different associated `Instance` types, a `BoxedNewService` trait is used to uniformize the return type of the new_service() method. This trait is implemented on all `NewService` implementations.

The composites make minimal assumptions about the associated types of the `NewService`s being combined - the functionality these types need to have for the composites to be formed is abstracted into the `HasPath` and `HasNotFound` traits (for the `Request` and `Response` associated types respectively). Implementations of these traits are provided for the concrete types that swagger-codegen uses for these associated types.

candidates.title: Logger in context + connectors
candidates.body: Adding a logger to Context, and adding some utility methods for creating https and http connectors.

candidates.title: Update changelog and bump version to 0.8.1
candidates.body: Keith, please can you review the updated changelog?  Once this is merged, I'll publish a new version of the crate, so that the changelog is live.

candidates.title: Allow `Context` to be bound to `Api`, and not passed on every function call
Add issuer to auth
candidates.body:
After discussion re #14 we agreed to add `issuer` - knowing who did something is very important for audit purposes; just knowing who it was done to is not enough. Also it is useful to be able to report per-issuer (i.e., per-third-party-app) statistics from server applications, and this is easier if that information is present within the application (rather than just in logs).

We agreed to drop `auth_type` and `expiry_deadline`. The first (`auth_type`) would encourage services to have auth-type-dependent behaviour, making the testing matrix more complex; the second (`expiry_deadline`) is not actually useful - authenticators may wish to do internal caching based on deadlines, but the validity period of the auth data doesn't imply anything about the validity period of the requester's authorization.

This is a breaking change (new field in struct), hence there is a version bump. If approved, I'll tag and release the library to cargo.

candidates.title: Revert xml
candidates.body: Revert xml support changes since they depend on a repository rather than a crate.

candidates.title: Revert "Add metadata about auth to Authorization"
Add conversion of serde-xml-rs errors for xml support
candidates.body:
In order to add xml support to swagger codegen, we need to add support for the error types used by serde-xml-rs during serialization and deserialization. 

This PR adds a conversion trait to generate ApiErrors from serde-xml-rs::Error.

The build currently pulls from a fork of serde-xml-rs, I will re-direct it to point at the official crate once the corresponding pull request to serde-xml-rs is accepted.

candidates.title: Add metadata about auth to Authorization
candidates.body:
It is often useful to gather metadata about an authentication for microservices to use, both for logging and for further authorization purposes. This PR brings the following new fields on the `Authorization` struct:

* `auth_type` - the authentication mechanism that generated this authorization data. In cases where the authorization data is delegated to other microservices, this field contains the original authentication mechanism.
* `issuer` - when a system is operating on behalf of a subject, the issuer field stores the identity of the system. Optional.
* `expiry_deadline` - used when the authorization data is cached, used to start a session, or used to construct a token passed back to the client, and expiry information is needed. Optional.

This constitutes a breaking change of the API, so the version of the crate has been bumped to 0.4.0

candidates.title: Add readme to Cargo.toml
candidates.body: To get it rendered by crates.io

candidates.title: Introduce AllowAllMiddleware for dummy authorization
candidates.body:
Useful for testing, such as the codegen sample tests which define authorization but always need to succeed.

Since the auth stuff was getting quite large, I've also moved it to a separate file and have pulled in Authorization and AuthData as `pub use` for compatibility.

candidates.title: Add Support for Nullables
candidates.body:
Per much discussion we've had, we want to support properties in our API endpoints which may be set to the value `null`.  
We can indicate this in Swagger with the `x-nullable` property, for which there is precedent[[1]](https://github.com/OAI/OpenAPI-Specification/issues/229#issuecomment-222942851).

**For existing users of the binary types, this is a breaking change**.

This is achieved through the introduction of a new type, `Nullable<T>`.  
The nullable type represents values that are present on the API request, but have the value `null`.  
Values that are null are represented as `Null`, while values that are present are represented as `Present(value)`.

This is distinct from values that are not present in the request JSON.  
If a nullable value is not present in a request, the deserialization fails, as it would with any other non-optional value.

Nullable values may themselves be optional, through the `Option<Nullable<T>>` type.  
Again, the distinction is made between a value that is not present, and a value that is `null` - values that are not present are `Option::None`, null values are `Option::Some(Nullable::Null)`, and present values are `Option::Some(Nullable::Present(value))`.

All of this, of course, also applies to response values (i.e. both Deserialization and Serialization are supported).

For convenience, the `Nullable` type implements many of the methods present on the `Option` type, such as `map`, `unwrap`, and `and_then`.

In order to accomplish this implementation, a modification has been made to the representation of binary string (i.e. base64-encoded) types.  
Previously, these were represented as `Vec<u8>`s, and had a special annotation added to the generated model to ensure they were (de)serialized by the correct method.  
This annotation clashed with the annotation required by optional nullable types, and so these have been moved to a Newtype, namely `ByteArray(Vec<u8>)`.  
This type implements the Deserialize and Serialize traits, meaning no annotation is required.  
Existing users of the binary types who regenerate their code must then wrap their `Vec<u8>` instantiations in a constructor for the `ByteArray` type.  
The Deref trait has been implemented to allow automatic deref coercion to the underlying `Vec<u8>` type.


*This merge has a related code changes in a merge request to the code generator, which includes the necessary Rust changes to correctly use these types, as well as documentation generation changes.*

chosen_pr.title: Update base64 requirement from 0.5 to 0.10

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

chosen_pr.body:
Updates the requirements on [base64](https://github.com/alicemaz/rust-base64) to permit the latest version.
Changelog *Sourced from [base64's changelog](https://github.com/alicemaz/rust-base64/blob/master/RELEASE-NOTES.md).* > # 0.10.0 > > - Remove line wrapping. Line wrapping was never a great conceptual fit in this library, and other features (streaming encoding, etc) either couldn't support it or could support only special cases of it with a great increase in complexity. Line wrapping has been pulled out into a [line-wrap](https://crates.io/crates/line-wrap) crate, so it's still available if you need it. > - `Base64Display` creation no longer uses a `Result` because it can't fail, which means its helper methods for common > configs that `unwrap()` for you are no longer needed > - Add a streaming encoder `Write` impl to transparently base64 as you write. > - Remove the remaining `unsafe` code. > - Remove whitespace stripping to simplify `no_std` support. No out of the box configs use it, and it's trivial to do yourself if needed: `filter(|b| !b" \n\t\r\x0b\x0c".contains(b)`. > - Detect invalid trailing symbols when decoding and return an error rather than silently ignoring them. > > # 0.9.3 > > - Update safemem > > # 0.9.2 > > - Derive `Clone` for `DecodeError`. > > # 0.9.1 > > - Add support for `crypt(3)`'s base64 variant. > > # 0.9.0 > > - `decode_config_slice` function for no-allocation decoding, analogous to `encode_config_slice` > - Decode performance optimization > > # 0.8.0 > > - `encode_config_slice` function for no-allocation encoding > > # 0.7.0 > > - `STANDARD_NO_PAD` config > - `Base64Display` heap-free wrapper for use in format strings, etc > > # 0.6.0 > > - Decode performance improvements > - Use `unsafe` in fewer places > - Added fuzzers > > # 0.5.2 > > - Avoid usize overflow when calculating length > - Better line wrapping performance > > # 0.5.1 > > - Temporarily disable line wrapping > ... (truncated)
Commits - See full diff in [compare view](https://github.com/alicemaz/rust-base64/commits/v0.10.0)

Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. repo.name: swagger-rs
repo.description: A set of common utilities for crates generated by swagger-codegen

repo.name: swagger-rs
repo.description: A set of common utilities for crates generated by swagger-codegen
